private_information: I can only move blocks whose labels are vowels: A E I O U
I can only interact with the top block of any stack
I can move one block at a time
I must respect that other agent can move only consonant blocks
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks to reach the global stacked goal configuration where all blocks form the target tower.

private_information: I can only move blocks whose labels are consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only interact with the top block of any stack
I can move one block at a time
I must respect that other agent can move only vowel blocks
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks to reach the global stacked goal configuration where all blocks form the target tower.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' partial plans and produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownward planner that achieves the specified target tower configuration.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labelled blocks: M L H K C A I D N F B J E G
Two stacks are present initially: stack1 with bottom M and top G, stack2 with bottom H and top E
Agents can only move blocks that are on the top of a stack
Agents move one block at a time
One agent can move only vowel-labelled blocks and the other only consonant-labelled blocks
The goal is a single tower with N on the table and A on top following the order A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on M on N on the table

plan.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulating agent that can only move vowel-labelled blocks. Produce a sequence of concrete moves that respect your constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Each move should be expressed as a single-line action such as 'move A from stackX to stackY' or 'move A from X to Y' where X and Y name stacks or blocks. Indicate preconditions when relevant and keep actions atomic and ordered.
plan.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Use the public information about the world and your private constraints to propose a partial plan of moves that you can execute. Provide only move steps and short notes about which top-block constraint they rely on. Do not assume the other agent's plan unless explicitly provided. Output a JSON-friendly plain string summary under the output key name.

plan.system_prompt: You are a block-manipulating agent that can only move consonant-labelled blocks. Produce a sequence of concrete moves that respect your constraints. Do not produce PDDL. Each move should be expressed as a single-line action such as 'move B from stackX to stackY' or 'move B from X to Y'. Indicate preconditions when relevant and keep actions atomic and ordered.
plan.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Use the public information about the world and your private constraints to propose a partial plan of moves that you can execute. Provide only move steps and short notes about which top-block constraint they rely on. Do not assume the other agent's plan unless explicitly provided. Output a JSON-friendly plain string summary under the output key name.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning targeting the FastDownward solver. Your task is to integrate partial move sequences provided by two agents and generate a complete PDDL domain and problem that encodes the blocksworld instance and enforces agent-specific move constraints. Produce a domain and a problem suitable for FastDownward (PDDL 2.1 compatible). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by naming them appropriately (for example move-vowel and move-consonant or by adding an agent parameter), and ensure the domain encodes that vowel_agent may only move vowels and consonant_agent may only move consonants and that moves operate only on top blocks and move one block at a time.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the environment public information and the agents' private constraints to produce a final PDDL domain and problem for the global goal. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Vowel agent knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Consonant agent knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Here is the partial plan reported by the vowel agent: {plan_vowel}. Here is the partial plan reported by the consonant agent: {plan_consonant}. Use these as hints but do not assume they are complete or conflict-free. Resolve naming ambiguities and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and problem that FastDownward can accept and that captures the requirement that only vowel blocks may be moved by the vowel agent and only consonant blocks by the consonant agent. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
